verses.roman:
tomā-sabāra ei mata,--rāja-ṭhāñi yāñā
kauḍi māgi' laṅ muñi āṅcala pātiyā

synonyms: tomā-sabāra—of all of you; ei mata—this is the opinion; rāja-ṭhāñi yāñā—going to the King; kauḍi māgi'-begging kauḍis; laṅ—shall take; muñi—I; āṅcala pātiyā—spreading My cloth.
translation: "Your opinion is that I should go to the King's palace and spread My cloth to beg money from him.
